results.title: Migration: after eighteen months (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description: This is the last film about the Rata family and their emigration from Finland to Australia. It looks at the occurrences of the 18 months stay and the reasons leading to the family’s decision to return home to Finland. It contrasts their expectations with the reality of living in Australia.

results.title: The Middle East: crossroads of three continents
results.brief_description: The scarcity of rainfall and water supply, the significance of being an international crossroad and the importance of rich oil deposits are three key ideas developed in relation to the countries of the Middle East. Their need for water and its effect on their economy is illustrated. The region is considered as a crossroads of peoples, historic cultures and trade. Three-quarters of the world’s reserves of oil are found here; this valuable product has had an important effect on relations of the Middle East with the rest of the world.

results.title: Microscopic fungi
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Hugh O'Connor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A motion picture camera linked to a microscope uncovers a world of fascinating and colorful activity—the world of fungus growth. Highly magnified color cross-sections of vegetable substances attacked by various kinds of fungi give unusually clear illustrations of how these micro-organisms spread and reproduce, and also show their many useful functions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.V. Durden, Hugh O’Connor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Microscope
results.creator_credit: Alex Strasser, John Taylor and Realist Films
results.brief_description: This film is designed for upper secondary and tertiary students of biology, medicine etc. Its purpose is to encourage the efficient and careful use of microscopes. The parts of the microscope, the correct way to set it up and the routine of procedure for high-power work are explained.

results.title: Microphone speaking
results.brief_description: Teaches the proper use of microphones in public address systems and radio. The microphone can be a help or a hindrance, depending upon how the speaker uses it. How would Lincoln’s Gettysburg Address have gone over if he had been constantly interrupted by feedback?

results.title: The Microphone
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the structure, and the functioning, of both the primitive and the improved types of carbon and ribbon microphones, as well as an analysis of the ribbon microphone and its use in a film studio.

results.title: Michael and the flying boats
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to convey to children the excitement and interest connected with air transport. It shows the adventures and investigations of a small boy at an airport as he watches the departure of a flying boat for South Africa, and illustrates the work of the ground staff and air crew, the organisation of the airport, and some details of the structure and mechanism of the flying boat.

results.title: Metrication: managing the change over
results.creator_credit: Charles Pascoe, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Attempts to show how a company changeover to the metric system can be planned and implemented in order to minimise costs and maximise benefits. Indicates the type of senior management decisions required following the initial tasks survey and discusses how metrication should be implemented, timed and monitored in relation to cost effectiveness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Pascoe, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
